content: This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Senior assistant commissioner" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(June 2021)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Senior assistant commissioner** is a rank used in the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force), [Singapore Civil Defence Force](/wiki/Singapore_Civil_Defence_Force), the [New South Wales Police Force](/wiki/New_South_Wales_Police_Force) of Australia, [Royal Malaysia Police](/wiki/Royal_Malaysia_Police) and the [Hong Kong Police Force](/wiki/Hong_Kong_Police_Force). ## Australia The rank of senior assistant commissioner has been abolished from all Police Forces and Services in Australia. [*citation needed*] ## Singapore In Singapore, a senior assistant commissioner of Police is a [police rank](/wiki/Police_rank) of a senior officer in the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force) above the rank of [assistant commissioner](/wiki/Assistant_commissioner_(police)) and below that of a [deputy commissioner of police](/wiki/Deputy_commissioner_of_police_(Singapore)). ## Hong Kong [Hong Kong Police](/wiki/Hong_Kong_Police) senior assistant commissioners are responsible for either headquarter command roles or regional/geographic commands. SAC are head of departments and also referred to as Directors of these departments. This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This [law enforcement](/wiki/Outline_of_law_enforcement)–related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Senior assistant commissioner
